qas.question: Who was the Master general of the Dominican Order during the mid 1200s?
What years was Humbert of Rome the Master General?
What did Humbert do that was very significant during his time as Master general?

answers.text: the sisters in the order were given official membership

qas.question: What did subject did Humbert love very much?
What language did Humbert want the Dominican Order members to learn?
Who was the Master general of the Dominican order during the early 1200s?
During whose tenure was the sisters of the order not given official membership?
Who did not have a great love of languages?
What did Hobart not want the friars to reach?

plausible_answers.text: growth of the spirituality of young preachers

qas.question: What was not Hobart's first priority?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>Humbert of Romans<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, the master general of the order from <a1_0>1254 to 1263<a1_0/>, was a great administrator, as well as preacher and writer. It was under his tenure as master general that <a2_0>the sisters in the order were given official membership<a2_0/>. <b7_0>Humbert<b7_0/> was a great lover of <a3_0>languages<a3_0/>, and encouraged linguistic studies among the Dominicans, primarily <a4_0>Arabic<a4_0/>, because of the missionary work friars were pursuing amongst those led astray or forced to convert by Muslims in the Middle East. He also wanted his friars to reach <b8_0>excellence in their preaching<b8_0/>, and this was his most lasting contribution to the order. The <b9_0>growth of the spirituality of young preachers<b9_0/> was his first priority. He once cried to his students: "... consider how excellent this office [of preaching] is, because it is apostolic; how useful, because it is directly ordained for the salvation of souls; how perilous, because few have in them, or perform, what the office requires, for it is not without great danger ... , vol. xxv. (Lyon, 1677)
